title: Why doesn't Quora show some topics at which I'm the Most Viewed Writer? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you’re looking for questions to answer, you can find questions by your topics in the Answer tab and then in “Questions for You.” In the list, below “Top Questions for You” and “Questions Asked by People You Follow” are sections of questions by topic that you “Know About” per your profile. Note: The above is based on the Windows/Chrome interface. On my iPad app, the list does not include the “Top Questions for You” category. The iPad app also shows “For You” rather than “Questions for You.” So your results may vary. (Joke: The appearance of all of these things and where to find them may also depend on the phase of the moon.) If I’ve misread the intent of your question, please let me know in comments.

Sometimes it takes a while for Quora to show you as most viewed writer. I was a MVW in Twin Peaks (tv series) long before it showed me as such. (Yes, I'm a dork - I checked). Give it a week or so, and it should, show you as a most viewed writer. Thanks for the A2A!
